items.name: Component_BindingHandler
items.content:
# =================================================================== # # Script: Component_BindingHandler # # $$COPYRIGHT$$ # # =================================================================== class Component_BindingHandler extends ui.Component_Handler ###* * Caches already compiled binding-paths. * @property compiledPaths * @type Object * @static ### @compiledPaths: {} ###* * A binding-handler component allows a UI game object to execute * property-bindings.

* * For example: A text-label can bind its text-property to a backend-field * like the current music-volume to always display correct music-volume. * If the volume changes, the text-property will be updated * automatically. * * To define a binding, a special property-path syntax is used. For example:
*
* $myTextField.text
*
* is a property-path to access the text-property of a text-field object * with the identifier "myTextField". For more information, take a look * into the "In Game UI System" section of the help-file. * * @module ui * @class Component_BindingHandler * @extends ui.Component_Handler * @memberof ui * @constructor ### constructor: () -> ###* * Initializes the binding-handler. * * @method setup ### setup: -> ###* * Updates the binding-handler. * * @method update ### update: -> for binding in @object.bindings @executeBinding(binding) @object.initialized = yes return null ###* * Executes a specified binding. The binding is only executed if all assigned * events and conditions are true. * * @method executeBinding * @param {Object} binding - The binding to execute. ### executeBinding: (binding) -> return if not @checkObject(binding) source = binding.sourceFunc ? (binding.sourceFunc=@resolveFieldPath(binding.sourceField)) target = binding.targetFunc ? (binding.targetFunc=@resolveFieldPath(binding.targetField)) return if !target return target.set(@object, null) if !source value = source.get(@object) offset = 0 if binding.offset? value += binding.offset if binding.max? value = Math.min(binding.max, value) if binding.min? value = Math.max(binding.min, value) target.set(@object, value) ###* * Evaluates a specified property-path and returns the result. * * @method fieldValue * @param {string} path - A property-path. * @return {Object} The value of the property-path. ### fieldValue: (path) -> ui.Component_BindingHandler.fieldValue(@object, path) ###* * Executes a specified binding. The binding is only executed if all assigned * events and conditions are true. * * @method executeBinding * @param {Object} binding - The binding to execute. * @static ### @executeBinding: (sender, binding) -> binder = new ui.BindingHandler() binder.object = sender binder.executeBinding(binding) ###* * Evaluates a property-path on a specified object and returns the result. * * @method fieldValue * @static * @param {Object} object - An object to evaluate the property-path on. * @param {string} path - A property-path. * @return {Object} The value of the property-path. ### @fieldValue: (object, path) -> if typeof path == "string" field = ui.Component_BindingHandler.resolveFieldPath(object, path) return 0 unless field? return field.get(object) else return path ###* * Resolves a property-path of a specified object and returns the result. The * result-object has a get- and an optional set-function to get or set the * value for the property-path. The set-function is only present for property-paths * which can be written. * * @method resolveFieldPath * @static * @param {Object} object - An object to evaluate the property-path on. * @param {string} path - A property-path. * @return {Object} The result-object containing a get- and set-function to manipulate the property-value. ### @resolveFieldPath: (object, path) -> result = ui.Component_BindingHandler.compiledPaths[path] if result? then return result if path? result = { set: null, get: null } result.get = eval("(function(o) { return " + path + " })") result.set = eval("(function(o, v) { " + path + " = v; })") ui.Component_BindingHandler.compiledPaths[path] = result return result ###* * Resolves a property-path and returns the result. The * result-object has a get- and an optional set-function to get or set the * value for the property-path. The set-function is only present for property-paths * which can be written. * * @method resolveFieldPath * @param {Object} object - An object to evaluate the property-path on. * @param {string} path - A property-path. * @return {Object} The result-object containing a get- and set-function to manipulate the property-value. ### resolveFieldPath: (path) -> ui.Component_BindingHandler.resolveFieldPath(@object, path) ui.Component_BindingHandler = Component_BindingHandler
